column4: I am trying to install lightscribe drivers and get the error "wrong archetecture i386"  Any idea what the problem is
Are you running amd64 Ubuntu?
I right click on it and select open with Gdebipackage installer
The message means either than you're running amd64 and trying to install an i386 package, or running i386 and trying to install an amd64 package (not sure which)
yes running AMD64 Ubuntu.
You can't install an i386 .deb on amd64 Ubuntu...  do they have an amd64 .deb?
guess not, any idea where to get it?
same place you got the i386 one, I guess
not one there and I need my lightscribe.
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=106197
hmm, nevermind, that's outdated
ty, will try it.
anyway, the Lightscribe driver for Linux is closed-source, I believe
ok
meaning???
meaning that if they don't provide an amd64 version of it, there's nothing you can do about it
any idea who might be able to adapt it, re-write it...
the company that provides it; they're the only ones who have the source code
I might be able to reverse engineer it
If you have experience doing that sort of thing, feel free, and document what you find
I just don't know what to change.
